Osho_The Last Testament, Vol 3, Chapter #18
8 October 1985 pm in Sanai Grove
all text is attached in folder
	
INTERVIEW WITH CHRIST KEIZER, THE BOSTON GLOBE, BOSTON, MA
QUESTION:* I WAS NOTICING YOUR CALLIGRAPHY ON THE WALL OVER 

THERE, THE ONE THAT SAYS THE HUMAN HEART IS THE MOST DANGEROUS 

THING IN THE WORLD.

ANSWER:* That's true.

Q:* WHY?

A:* (laughing) Just listen to your heart, how fast it is beating.

Every Master is a dangerous person. To be near to a Master you have to lose your 

ego, which is the most difficult thing in the world.

Q:* WHAT IS DANGEROUS ABOUT THE HUMAN HEART?

A:* About ego everything is ugly. But the whole society, education, religion -- they all 

teach you ambition, and ambition is nourishment for the ego.

The Master's function is to undo whatever the society, religion, culture, has done to 

you. It is a total deprogramming.

The Master brings you back to the innocence in which you were born. And that is the 

danger.

Nobody wants to lose knowledgeability, nobody wants to lose his fame, his 

respectability....

Q:* BUT DANGEROUS FOR WHO?

A:* Dangerous for the ego.....
